meanings.definition: Damfools (noun): a group of people who are considered foolish or stupid
meanings.sent1: The damfools in the movie kept making silly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to those damfools, they don't know what they're talking about.
meanings.sent3: The damfools at the party thought it was a good idea to play with fire.
meanings.sent4: The damfools in the story ignored all the warnings and faced the consequences.
meanings.sent5: The image of the damfools dancing in the rain stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: Damfools (adjective): describing someone or something as foolish or stupid
meanings.sent1: She made a damfools mistake by trusting a stranger.
meanings.sent2: It was a damfools decision to go out without an umbrella in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The damfools cat knocked over the vase and made a mess.
meanings.sent4: The damfools plan to rob a bank was doomed from the start.
meanings.sent5: The damfools driver ignored the red light and caused an accident.
